bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Paul Joseph Bass was born in 1960. He grew up in White Plains, New York, and attended the Horace Mann School in the Bronx, New York. At Horace Mann, he wrote for a variety of student publications and also contributed to Westchester County newspapers, where he would frequently work during summers. As a student at Yale College, Bass continued to participate in journalism primarily as a writer for the Yale Daily News and also as a contributor to other newspapers. After graduation in 1982, Bass became a free-lance journalist, with his writings appearing in such newspapers as the New Haven Advocate , New York Times , In These Times , and many others. In 1986, Bass, his wife, Carole, and another couple founded a weekly newspaper called the New Haven Independent . In 1989, he joined the staff of the New Haven Advocate . He has won numerous awards and is known for reporting on social, political, and cultural issues in New Haven and around the world.

scopecontent.p: The papers consist of topical files and clippings relating to the career of Paul Bass as a journalist primarily covering affairs in New Haven and Connecticut. scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically, the series includes research materials used by Paul and Carole Bass. It also includes administrative files relating to the New Haven Independent , a weekly independent newspaper with an emphasis on investigative journalism, published in the late 1980s. Materials related to the American Independent Movement consist of FBI files obtained by Paul Bass through a Freedom Of Information Act request, and they document the activities of a leftist radical group functioning in New Haven during 1960s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arranged chronologically, the series consists of clippings of Paul Bass articles from the Horace Mann Record , Reporter Dispatch (White Plains, New York), Yale Daily News , New Haven Register , Hartford Courant , New York Times , Fair Haven News , In These Times , New Haven Independent , and New Haven Advocate . The series also contains clippings of Carole Bass articles from many of the same publications. The series ranges from when Paul Bass was a high school student at Horace Mann in New York to his time as an associate editor of the New Haven Advocate .

The series reflects the careers of Paul and Carole Bass as investigative journalists primarily working in New Haven, Connecticut, and therefore documents most of the major news stories in the city from the early 1980s through the mid-2000s.
